oneOf.title: EvaluateTransactionFailure
oneOf.description: Happens when attempting to evaluate execution units on a node that isn't enough synchronized.

oneOf.title: EvaluateTransactionFailure[IncompatibleEra]
oneOf.description: Returned when trying to evaluate execution units of a pre-Alonzo transaction. Note that this isn't possible with Ogmios because transactions are always de-serialized as Alonzo transactions.

oneOf.title: EvaluateTransactionFailure[OverlappingAdditionalUtxo]
oneOf.description: Happens when providing an additional UTXO set which overlaps with the UTXO on-chain.

oneOf.title: EvaluateTransactionFailure[NodeTipTooOld]
oneOf.description: Happens when attempting to evaluate execution units on a node that isn't enough synchronized.

oneOf.title: EvaluateTransactionFailure[CannotCreateEvaluationContext]
oneOf.description: The transaction is malformed or missing information; making evaluation impossible.

oneOf.title: EvaluateTransactionFailure[ScriptExecutionFailure]
oneOf.description: One or more script execution terminated with an error.

RpcError.title: RpcError
RpcError.description: A generic error in the JSON-RPC protocol. This is returned by the server when a request from clients is deemed invalid or, when the server was unable to reply to a well-formed request.

code.description: An error code telling about the nature of the error.

message.description: A descriptive error message giving hints about the error.

data.description: Some optional data / context about the error. The exact type of this (optional) field depends on the error.

id.description: Any value that was set by a client request in the 'id' field.

Address.description: A Cardano address (either legacy format or new format).

AddressAttributes.description: Extra attributes carried by Byron addresses (network magic and/or HD payload).

AssetQuantity.description: A number of asset, can be negative went burning assets.

Block.description: A Cardano Block, which can take different forms depending on the era.

Block[Byron].description: A block in the Byron era. Most blocks are stanard blocks, but once at the beginning of each era is an additional epoch boundary block (a.k.a. EBB)

BlockNo.description: A block number, the i-th block to be minted is number i.

BlockSize.description: The size of the block in bytes.

Bound.description: An era bound which captures the time, slot and epoch at which the era start. The time is relative to the start time of the network.

oneOf.description: A stake delegation certificate, from a delegator to a stake pool.
oneOf.title: stakeDelegation
moveInstantaneousRewards
oneOf.description: Either `value` or `rewards` will be present, but never both.

ChainCode.description: An Ed25519-BIP32 chain-code for key deriviation.

Digest[Blake2b]::AuxiliaryDataBody.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of an 'AuxiliaryDataBody', serialised as CBOR.

Digest[Blake2b]::Block[*].body.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of an era-independent block body.

oneOf.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of an era-independent block header, serialised as CBOR.

Digest[Blake2b]::Block[Byron].body.dlgPa.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a Byron delegation payload, CBOR-encoded.

Digest[Blake2b]::Block[Byron].body.txPay.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a Byron transaction witness set, CBOR-encoded.

Digest[Blake2b]::Block[Byron].body.updat.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a Byron update payload, CBOR-encoded.

Digest[Blake2b]::Credential.description: A Blake2b 28-byte digest of a verification key or a script.

Digest[Blake2b]::Datum.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a serialized datum, CBOR-encoded.

Digest[Blake2b]::MerkleRoot.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a Merkle tree (or all block's transactions) root hash.

Digest[Blake2b]::Nonce.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of some arbitrary to make a nonce.

Digest[Blake2b]::PoolMetadata.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of stake pool (canonical) JSON metadata.

Digest[Blake2b]::Script.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a phase-1 or phase-2 script, CBOR-encoded.

Digest[Blake2b]::ScriptIntegrity.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a script-integrity hash (i.e redeemers, datums and cost model, CBOR-encoded).

Digest[Blake2b]::VerificationKey.description: A Blake2b 28-byte digest of an Ed25519 verification key.

Digest[Blake2b]::VrfVerificationKey.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a VRF verification key.

EraParameters.description: Parameters that can vary across hard forks.

EraSummary.description: Summary of the confirmed parts of the ledger.

EvaluateTransactionFailure[ScriptExecuti.title: ScriptExecutionFailure
EvaluateTransactionFailure[ScriptExecuti.description: Some script in the transaction terminated with an error.

EvaluateTransactionFailure[IncompatibleE.title: IncompatibleEra
EvaluateTransactionFailure[IncompatibleE.description: The era in which the transaction has been identified.

Genesis[Byron].description: A Byron genesis configuration, with information used to bootstrap the era. Some parameters are also updatable across the era.

Genesis[Shelley].description: A Shelley genesis configuration, with information used to bootstrap the era. Some parameters are also updatable across the era.

Genesis[Alonzo].description: An Alonzo genesis configuration, with information used to bootstrap the era. Some parameters are also updatable across the era.

GenesisDelegate.description: A Genesis delegate, in charge of Cardano's governance.

GenesisPools.description: A Genesis stake pools configuration; primarily used for bootstrapping test networks.

GenesisVerificationKey.description: An Ed25519-BIP32 Byron genesis delegate verification key with chain-code.

IssuerVrfVerificationKey.description: A key identifying a block issuer.

IssuerSignature.description: Signature proving a block was issued by a given issuer VRF key.

LiveStakeDistribution.description: Distribution of stake across registered stake pools. Each key in the map corresponds to a pool id.

Lovelace.description: A number of lovelace, possibly large when summed up.

LovelaceDelta.description: An amount, possibly negative, in Lovelace (1e6 Lovelace = 1 Ada).

Network.description: A network target, as defined since the Shelley era.

NetworkMagic.description: A magic number for telling networks apart. (e.g. 764824073)

OpCert.description: Certificate identifying a stake pool operator.

Origin.description: The origin of the blockchain. This point is special in the sense that it doesn't point to any existing slots, but is preceding any existing other point.
Origin.title: Origin
Origin.name: Oirigin

oneOf.description: A point on the chain, identified by a slot and a block header hash.
oneOf.title: Point
oneOf.name: Point

ProjectedRewards.description: Rewards that can be expected assuming a pool is fully saturated. Such rewards are said non-myopic, in opposition to short-sighted rewards looking at immediate benefits. Keys of the map can be either Lovelace amounts or account credentials depending on the query.

StakePoolId.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a pool's verification key.

ownerStake.description: The number of Lovelace owned by the stake pool owners. If this value is not at least as large as the 'pledgeRatio', the stake pool will not earn any rewards for the given epoch.

approximatePerformance.description: Number of blocks produced divided by expected number of blocks (based on stake and epoch progress). Can be larger than 1.0 for pools that get lucky.

poolParameters.description: Some of the pool parameters relevant for the reward calculation.

Ratio.description: A ratio of two integers, to express exact fractions.

RelativeTime.description: A time in seconds relative to another one (typically, system start or era start). Starting from v5.5.4, this can be a floating number. Before v5.5.4, the floating value would be rounded to the nearest second.

RewardAccount.description: A reward account, also known as 'stake address'.

RewardPot.description: Source of rewards as defined by the protocol parameters.

RewardsProvenance.description: Details about how rewards are calculated for the ongoing epoch.

poolInfluence.description: Influence of the pool owner's pledge on rewards, as a ratio of two integers.

totalRewards.description: Total rewards available for the given epoch.

activeStake.description: The total amount of staked Lovelace during this epoch.

SafeZone.description: Number of slots from the tip of the ledger in which it is guaranteed that no hard fork can take place. This should be (at least) the number of slots in which we are guaranteed to have k blocks.

Script[Native].description: A phase-1 monetary script. Timelocks constraints are only supported since Allegra.

Script[Plutus].description: A phase-2 Plutus script; or said differently, a serialized Plutus-core program.

ScriptFailure[missingRequiredScripts].title: missingRequiredScripts
ScriptFailure[missingRequiredScripts].description: Missing scripts required for validating script inputs.

ScriptFailure[validatorFailed].title: validatorFailed
ScriptFailure[validatorFailed].description: Plutus interpreter error. Returns additional traces produced by the validator.

ScriptFailure[unknownInputReferencedByRe.title: unknownInputReferencedByRedeemer
ScriptFailure[unknownInputReferencedByRe.description: Non-existing input referenced by a redeemer pointer.

ScriptFailure[nonScriptInputReferencedBy.title: nonScriptInputReferencedByRedeemer
ScriptFailure[nonScriptInputReferencedBy.description: Input not locked by a Plutus referenced by a redeemer pointer.

ScriptFailure[illFormedExecutionBudget].title: illFormedExecutionBudget
ScriptFailure[illFormedExecutionBudget].description: Invalid execution budget set for a redeemer. In principle, cannot happen in the context of Ogmios.

ScriptFailure[noCostModelForLanguage].title: noCostModelForLanguage
ScriptFailure[noCostModelForLanguage].description: Input locked by a script which language has no cost model in current protocol parameters. In principle, cannot happen in the context of Ogmios.

Signature.description: A signature coming from an Ed25519 or Ed25519-BIP32 signing key.

SlotLength.description: A slot length, in seconds. Starting from v5.5.4, this can be a floating number. Before v5.5.4, the floating value would be rounded to the nearest second.

oneOf.title: Base16
oneOf.description: A stake key or script hash in base16.

oneOf.title: Bech32
oneOf.description: A Blake2b 28-byte digest of a verification key or script.

SubmitTransactionError[expiredUtxo].title: expiredUtxo
SubmitTransactionError[expiredUtxo].description: Only in Shelley. Replaced with 'outsideOfValidityInterval' since Allegra.

badTranslation.description: An (hopefully) informative error about the transaction execution failure.

raw.description: The raw serialized transaction, as found on-chain.
The raw serialized transaction, as found on-chain.
The raw serialized transaction, as found on-chain.
The raw serialized transaction, as found on-chain.
The raw serialized transaction, as found on-chain.
The raw serialized transaction, as found on-chain.

TxId.description: A Blake2b 32-byte digest of a transaction body, CBOR-encoded.

TxOut.description: A transaction output. Since Mary, 'value' always return a multi-asset value. Since Alonzo, 'datumHash' is always present (albeit sometimes 'null'). Since Babbage, 'datum' & 'script' are always present (albeit sometimes 'null').

propertyNames.description:
A policy id with an (optional) asset name, dot-separated. Another way to visualize the regular expression given as pattern is through the following diagram: 
          
 POLICY_ID  .  ASSET_NAME 
         
                            
  POLICY_ID
The `POLICY_ID` and `ASSET_NAME` are both encoded in **base16** and are exactly 56 characters and at most 64 characters respectively.
